section.title: Reference: Script Editor Shortcut Keys
section.para: The GMAT Script Editor provides a user with text editor capabilities inside of the GMAT GUI. This article provides a listing of the current shortcut keys used in the Script Editor by release date. Shortcut key are subject to change in future releases. Check back to this article for Script Editor shortcut key updates.
Would you like to take part in discussions for possible changes to the current shortcut keys? If so, visit the following forum topic:
[http://gmat.ed-pages.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=107|Proposed Shortcut Keys inside GMAT (Text Fields)]

section.title: 2008-09-30 and 2007-12-10
section.para: ||Ctrl + C | Copy
Ctrl + X | Cut
Ctrl + V | Paste
Ctrl + Z | Undo
Ctrl + Y | Redo
Ctrl + A | Select All
Tab | Move cursor to the next input field
Shift + Tab | Move cursor to the previous input field
Ctrl + L | Aligns highlighted text to the left (default alignment)
Ctrl + E | Aligns highlighted text to the center (This alignment is not saved when the script is reloaded)
Ctrl + R | Aligns highlighted text to the right (This alignment is not saved when the script is reloaded)
Ctrl + J | Aligns highlighted text to justified left?? (This alignment is not saved when the script is reloaded)
Ctrl + track mouse scroll | Enlarge/Decrease text size in script editor||

Ctrl + T | Comments highlighted text. (The entire line has to be highlighted)
Ctrl + M | Uncomments highlighted text. (The entire line has to be highlighted)
Ctrl + track mouse scroll | Enlarge/Decrease text size in script editor||
